p: Both the prominence, and increasing frequency of, H6Nx infections highlights the warranted need for increased surveillance efforts globally and particularly throughout the UK and Europe, where multiple outbreaks of H6N1 have been particularly problematic in recent weeks. This surveillance should also be continued in endemic regions, especially in poultry workers and vaccinated poultry. Additionally, the need for a concise and globally recognised lineage and nomenclature system is highly relevant and would allow better understanding of the potential threat of new reassortant and emerging H6Nx viruses.
